alert.note: Alert for Le Flore (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:11PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Franklin, Sebastian and east central Le Flore Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1011 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Denning to near Hackett. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Charleston... Greenwood... Mansfield... Hackett... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Branch... Midland... Denning... Excelsior... Bloomer... Washburn... Burnville... Fort Chaffee... Jenny Lind... Rock Island... Patterson... Caulksville... Roseville... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Arkansas...and southeastern Oklahoma.
